intro: Pteronia villosa, commonly known as the woolly pteronia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage and showy inflorescences. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and sandy soils, thriving in full sun. Its flowers, which range from white to pink, bloom in spring and attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Pteronia villosa is often cultivated for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
